docs.title: FoxLauncher
docs.text:
A completely local games launcher.

FoxLauncher is superior to other methods of playing games off your chromebook the net for various reasons:

  • It works with 90% of your unblocked games library with no tinkering from the developers.
  • Doesn't require bookmarklets.
  • Doesn't require an install games, nor to install the launcher.
  • Can use elevated chrome permissions.

docs.title: 1. Install Launcher
docs.text: Theres a couple ways to inject the entry point into a page, due to the only requirement being ACE.

docs.title: Bookmark
docs.text:
To install FoxLauncher via bookmarks.

  1. First drag the FoxLauncher bookmark into your browser's bookmark bar.
  2. Go to any website you can access at school, this does not include the new tab page.
  3. Copy and paste the url it give you into a new tab.
  4. Bookmark this new page then, install the resources to finish setup!

TODO: add more entry points

docs.title: 2. Install Resources
docs.text:
You're almost ready to install games. Grab zip.flr off our servers so you upload it on the FoxLauncher page.

Upload it the file, and it should give you a prompt to reload the page.

Reload the page after click "ok" with the button at the top of the page or via ctrl-r.

Once the page loads move onto the next step!

docs.title: 3. Install games
docs.text:
Now theres no more shenanigans! Just games for here. Download any .flz from games and load them up through the launcher.

Then they should pop-up in the game list section!

You can then bookmark the game link, then click said bookmark to play the game!

docs.title: Credit
docs.text:
FoxLauncher is made by FoxMoss, with no other contributors.

Support the project by donating to my paypal.

If your a student, a teacher, or a system admin wanting to block FoxLauncher ;) shoot me an email at foxmoss@mediaology.com. Or find other ways to conact me at foxmoss.com/personal/.

docs.title: For Developers
docs.text: FoxLauncher is a platform that has a good deal of benefits that typical websites don't have. This page is dedicated to informing developers on the differences from typical web development.

docs.title: What are all these funny file names?
docs.text: .flr : FoxLauncher Resource, a js file .flz : FoxLauncher Zip, a zip file containing a folder of the same name

docs.title: Creating a .flz
docs.text:
An .flz will load provided it contains arbitrary zip data, but for usability its advised it contains a folder named the same thing as the folder.

Heres an example example .flz file tree

tab-game.zip
└── tab-game
    ├── index.html
    └── index.js

docs.title: Links, Reloading, and History
docs.text:
Basically any page load request that was not initiated by the browser or the user for a page using a filesystem: url will be blocked by chrome.

Please see Tab Control

docs.title: Extended Privileges
docs.text:
Most extended privileges FoxLaunched sites have can be summed up fairly easily. If FoxLauncher is installed on an extension page, you can then access the same chrome APIs that it has access to.

Check here for the list of all chrome APIs.

docs.title: Tab Control
docs.text:
Controlling tabs can instead be accessed by the chrome.tabs API. This API is accessible to most extensions and due to the possessive powers of FoxLauncher, if the filesystem is a child of an extension you can access the same control of an extension.

You can read the documentation for this API here developer.chrome.com/docs/extensions/reference/tabs/.

docs.title: BoyKisser API Injection
docs.text: The name says it all, you can probably guess the code for this one.
